meanings.definition: Deens (noun): plural of deen, a person's religious beliefs or duties
meanings.sent1: Her deens guide her actions and decisions every day.
meanings.sent2: The family shares similar deens and traditions.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally mixed up his deens and wore mismatched socks to the religious ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The deens of the community resonate with the values of kindness and compassion.
meanings.sent5: Learning about different deens around the world can be eye-opening and enriching.

meanings.definition: Deens (verb): third person singular present of deen, to make a loud noise
meanings.sent1: The fireworks deens loudly in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The thunder deens in the distance, signaling an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to deens at birds from the window, thinking it can catch them.
meanings.sent4: The music deens through the speakers, filling the room with energy.
meanings.sent5: The construction work outside deens throughout the day, creating a constant background noise.

meanings.definition: Deens (adjective): comparative form of deen, more deenful
meanings.sent1: She is the deens student in the class, always eager to learn.
meanings.sent2: The deens flowers in the garden attract many bees with their vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: His deens enthusiasm for the project is contagious among the team.
meanings.sent4: The deens sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The deens book on the shelf caught her eye with its intriguing cover.
